pageContext.description: An exceptionally large and splendid specimen in almost perfect preservation except where one edge was chipped in getting it out. Protected eyelets at base of blade.
pageContext.associations: Associated with a few imburnt human bones; nothing else.
pageContext.collection: Dorchester Museum 1934.40.1,Private Collection, Mr. Chell, Muckleford Farm,Lent to Dorchester Museum April 1932
pageContext.site: England,Dorset,Frampton,Close to Bradford Peverell Boundary Muckleford, West of, near SW angle of 6" OS Sheet Dorset XL NW.,Found by owner when digging out a badger on farm, March 1932, 3 ft deep, in anciently disturbed ground. (Map of site sent with original drawing).
pageContext.remarks: The chalk on the Downs comes within one foot of the surface, except where spear-head was found. Here anciently disturbed ground 4 ft. deep and perhaps 10 yards square has encouraged rabbits to burrow and here the badger had his earth.
